result.execSummary:
The defendant Rogelio Sanchez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Court orders a fine in the amount of $500.00 plus all costs, fees and surcharges due by 11/28/16. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*With credit for 8 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rogelio Sanchez Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rogelio Sanchez in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court sentences defendant to serve 8 days in the House of Correction with credit for 8 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders a fine in the amount of $500.00 plus all costs, fees and surcharges due by 11/28/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed.

Defendant Rogelio Sanchez in court with attorney Terese M. Dick by telephone.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for calendar call. Defendant provided the court with documentation of hospital visit. Court withdraws the previously issued bench warrant. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 5/16/2016. Defendant to bring proof of hospitalization at the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Rogelio Sanchez in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea and sentencing hearing.  Negotiations placed on the record by the state.  On motion of the state, Court ordered Habitual Criminality Repeater enhancer dismissed.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a judgment of conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rogelio Sanchez in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense counsel has received additional discovery and a new offer and would like more time to review. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Rogelio Sanchez in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rogelio Sanchez in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests another pretrial conference date.  All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Rogelio Sanchez in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Rogelio Sanchez in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  

Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
